title: Ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar moves Supreme Court for anticipatory bail - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 12:06 pm

Former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar has approached the Supreme Court to challenge the Delhi High Court's rejection of her anticipatory bail plea amid allegations of fraud related to reservation benefits.

  • Khedkar is accused of fraudulently availing reservation for OBC and Persons with Disabilities for UPSC exam.
  • The FIR cites existing documents in possession of the prosecution, suggesting no need for custodial interrogation.
  • She claims lack of criminal antecedents and entitlements under the All India Services Act and Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act.
  • UPSC has cancelled her selection and barred her from future exams due to these allegations.
  • The High Court initially granted Khedkar interim protection but subsequently vacated it, establishing a prima facie case against her.
“The material revealed that she was not a fit candidate for such benefits and that she had forged documents.” - Justice Chandra Dhari Singh

Khedkar's case reflects larger issues surrounding the integrity of public service examinations and the reservation system.
newTitle: Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

title: Fibre in diet can reduce risk of gut infections: 6 ways to add more fibre in meals - The Times of India
summary:
Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Risk of Gut Infections: 6 Ways to Add More Fibre in Meals

Date: December 8, 2023 | Source: IANS

The article discusses the importance of dietary fibre in reducing the risk of gut infections and suggests six practical ways to incorporate more fibre into meals.

  • Start the Day Right: Choose high-fibre breakfast options like whole-grain cereals or muesli topped with fruits and nuts.
  • Whole Grains Over Refined: Swap refined grains for whole grains like brown rice, quinoa, and whole-wheat bread.
  • Load Up on Fruits and Vegetables: Incorporate a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables into your diet for added fibre and nutrients.
  • Add Lentils and Beans: Use lentils, chickpeas, and beans in soups, salads, and stews for a fibre boost.
  • Choose Nuts and Seeds: Snack on nuts and seeds instead of less healthy options to increase your fibre intake.
  • Opt for Fibre-Enriched Foods: Look for packaged snacks and drinks labelled as high in fibre, but check ingredient lists for sugar and unhealthy fats.
“Dietary fiber reduces the chance of heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and some types of cancer.”

By incorporating these strategies, individuals can significantly boost their fibre intake, supporting overall gut health and reducing the risk of infections.
newTitle: Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Gut Infection Risk: 6 Simple Ways to Increase Intake

title: First full Moon of 2025: Will Wolf Moon be visible from India; know details - Business Standard
summary:
First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

Date: Today

Source: Unspecified

The first full moon of 2025, known as the Wolf Moon, features a rare occurrence where it will pass in front of Mars, leading to a lunar occultation.

Key Points:

  • The lunar occultation occurs as the moon obscures Mars, which is approximately 40,000 times brighter.
  • The full moon peaks at 3:57 AM IST.
  • The Wolf Moon is named for the active howling of wolves in January.
  • This celestial event can be viewed using telescopes or binoculars, as Mars will not be visible from India.
No, the first full moon of January 2025 wouldn't be visible from India.

Only locations in the contiguous United States and parts of Canada will witness this spectacular event.
newTitle: First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

title: Kerala man killed, one hurt in Russia-Ukraine conflict, confirms MEA - The Times of India
summary:

In a tragic incident related to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, a man from Kerala lost his life and another was injured. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has verified these reports.

  • A man from Kerala has died due to the ongoing conflict in Russia and Ukraine.
  • Another individual has sustained injuries from the same incident.
  • The MEA has confirmed these details amidst increasing reports of casualties from the conflict.
"The situation is deeply concerning as the conflict continues to escalate, leading to loss of life and injuries." - MEA Official

This incident highlights the far-reaching impacts of global conflicts, even affecting individuals far from the frontline.

Shah Rukh Khan calling comparison with Hrithik Roshan ‘shameless’, Rakesh Roshan getting shot: Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai at 25

The article reflects on the 25th anniversary of Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai, discussing the film's impact, the early rivalry between Hrithik Roshan and Shah Rukh Khan, and a personal tragedy faced by Rakesh Roshan.

  • Shah Rukh Khan's statement on being the last star in Bollywood is juxtaposed with the rise of Hrithik Roshan.
  • Hrithik's debut in Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai surprised audiences and established him as a major star.

  • A tragic event shortly after the film’s release when Rakesh Roshan was shot is described.
“I entered as a nobody and when I came out, there was hysteria all around me.” - Hrithik Roshan

Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai remains a significant moment in Bollywood history, marking both a star launch and personal challenges for the Roshan family.

title: Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: officials - The Hindu
summary:
Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: officials

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Hamas has confirmed acceptance of a draft agreement for a ceasefire in Gaza and the release of hostages, according to officials involved in the negotiations. Mediators from Qatar announced that talks are at their most promising stage.

  • Hamas’ acceptance marks a critical step in negotiations mediated by the U.S., Egypt, and Qatar.
  • About 100 Israelis are held hostage, with many believed to be deceased.
  • The agreement includes a three-phase plan for releasing hostages and a humanitarian aid surge.
  • Upcoming U.S. presidential inauguration adds urgency to reach a final deal.
“Today, we are at the closest point ever to having a deal,” said Qatari Foreign Ministry spokesman Majed al-Ansari.

In conclusion, there seems to be a significant movement towards a potential ceasefire and a resolution that could reshape the current conflict landscape in Gaza.
newTitle: Hamas Accepts Ceasefire Agreement for Gaza and Hostage Release

title: Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: Officials - Moneycontrol
summary:
Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: Officials

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Hamas has accepted a draft agreement for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and the release of dozens of hostages, according to officials involved in the discussions. Mediators from Qatar have indicated that negotiations are at their closest point yet to achieving a deal.

  • Hamas has accepted a ceasefire draft and hostages' release.
  • Negotiations described as being at the “closest point” to sealing a deal.
  • The proposed agreement was confirmed by several officials.
  • Final details are being worked out, needing approval from the Israeli Cabinet.
“Negotiations were at the closest point yet to sealing a deal.”

This potential ceasefire agreement could represent a significant step towards resolving ongoing tensions and violence in the region.
newTitle: Hamas Accepts Draft Ceasefire Agreement for Gaza and Hostage Release

Virat Kohli's participation in the ongoing Ranji Trophy is in doubt as the DDCA has not received confirmation of his availability. This situation arises as the BCCI stresses the importance of domestic match participation for players.

  • The DDCA awaits official communication from Kohli regarding his participation.
  • The BCCI has mandated players to justify their absence from domestic matches.
  • Rohit Sharma was seen attending Mumbai's Ranji practice, signaling his commitment to domestic cricket.
  • DDCA chief Ashok Sharma suggests Kohli should take inspiration from Mumbai players.
  • Shubman Gill confirmed for Punjab's upcoming fixture against Karnataka.
“Virat should take inspiration from the Mumbai cricketers and play for Delhi in domestic cricket, whenever he is available.” - Ashok Sharma

Kohli's choice to participate will be significant for maintaining India's competitiveness in red-ball cricket.

Market Wrap, January 14: Indices rebound after 4 days of decline; SENSEX rises 170 pts, NIFTY50 ends at 23,207.60 - Upstox
summary:
Market Wrap, January 14: Indices rebound after 4 days of decline; SENSEX rises 170 pts, NIFTY50 ends at 23,207.60

Date: January 14, Source: PTI

After four days of sharp decline, the equity benchmark indices, SENSEX and NIFTY50, bounced back on easing retail inflation and a rebound in global markets.

  • The SENSEX rose 169.62 points (0.22%) to settle at 76,499.63.
  • The NIFTY50 climbed 90.10 points (0.39%) to 23,176.05.
  • Retail inflation declined to a four-month low of 5.22% in December.
  • Adani Ports surged over 5%, while HCLTech dropped over 8% after disappointing earnings.
  • Foreign institutional investors offloaded equities worth ₹4,892.84 crore.
“The CEO expressed optimism for improvement in the demand environment and discretionary spending.”

The indices showed signs of recovery amid easing inflation and a positive trend in global markets, signaling potential stability after recent fluctuations.
newTitle: Market Indices Rebound After Decline: SENSEX Up 170 Points

India’s disinflation progress could derail amid sharp rupee depreciation - Moneycontrol
summary:
India’s Disinflation Progress Could Derail Amid Sharp Rupee Depreciation

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee has depreciated by 3.2% against the US dollar, which may hinder the country’s disinflationary progress, leading to higher import costs and inflation.

  • The Indian rupee has faced a notable depreciation, becoming the second least volatile currency after the Hong Kong dollar.
  • Experts warn that increased import costs may translate into imported inflation.
  • Economists indicate that sectors reliant on imported raw materials will face escalating costs, impacting consumer prices and spending.
  • Retail inflation in India saw a decline to 5.22% in December, thanks to easing food prices.

Aditi Gupta, Economist at Bank of Baroda: “Sectors heavily dependent on imported raw materials are likely to witness escalation in costs due to higher input prices, impacting margins.”

The sharp depreciation of the rupee poses significant challenges to India's economic stability, making it essential for policymakers to address the potential inflationary pressures while supporting growth.
newTitle: India’s Disinflation Progress at Risk Due to Rupee Depreciation

title: Dreadlocked Indian ascetics among 25 mln who take holy dip in Maha Kumbh Mela festival - Reuters India
summary:
Dreadlocked Indian Ascetics Among 35 Million Participants in Maha Kumbh Festival

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Reuters

The Maha Kumbh Mela, or Great Pitcher Festival, has attracted 35 million devotees this year, as naked Hindu ascetics and masses alike participate in a ritual believed to offer absolution from sins.

  • 35 million devotees took part in the holy dip.
  • Festival expected to boost the economy by $30 billion-$35 billion.
"The crowd today was fantastic," said ascetic Rakesh Kumar after his holy dip.

This year’s festival is praised for its organization and security, as it prepares to welcome over 400 million attendees over the six-week duration.
newTitle: Dreadlocked Indian Ascetics Among 35 Million Participants in Maha Kumbh Festival

title: Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Inside the management of the world’s largest pilgrimage - CNBCTV18
summary:
Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Inside the management of the world’s largest pilgrimage

Publication Date: 2025-01-12 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Maha Kumbh Mela, held in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, is recognized as the world’s largest gathering of humanity, with an expected 400 million visitors over six weeks.

  • A temporary city built for 150,000 pilgrims with sanitation facilities.
  • Massive security arrangements including over 50,000 personnel deployed.
  • Advanced technology used for surveillance and safety measures.
  • Significant investment in fire safety with ₹1.3 billion allocated.
  • Dedicated lost-and-found centers to assist separated families.
“Security is a cornerstone of the festival's management, with authorities implementing an extensive and multi-layered safety plan.”

The Maha Kumbh Mela serves as a testament to India's logistical capabilities in managing large-scale events, ensuring the safety and comfort of millions of participants.
newTitle: Managing the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Logistics and Security of the World's Largest Pilgrimage

title: Delhi Police link student behind school bomb threats with politically-affiliated NGO - The Hindu
Hospital Photos, Account Locked Amid Divorce: How 'Brad Pitt' Scammed Woman - NDTV
summary:
French Woman Scammed by Fake Brad Pitt for 800,000 Euros

Publication Date: Not specified Source: TF1

A French woman was deceived into believing she was in a relationship with actor Brad Pitt and lost 800,000 euros to a scammer using AI-generated images and messages.

  • The scammer contacted her on Instagram posing as Brad Pitt and his mother.
  • The victim, Anne, who was going through a divorce, was drawn in by romantic messages and declarations of love.
  • The scammer avoided voice calls while sending manipulated videos and images.
  • After Anne's divorce, the scammer claimed to need money for medical treatment, further escalating the scam.
  • The fraud was uncovered when Anne realized the deception upon seeing news about Pitt's actual relationships.
“There are so few men who write such things. I liked the man I was talking to and he knew how to talk to women,” said Anne.

This case highlights the dangers of online scams and the emotional vulnerability that can be exploited.
newTitle: French Woman Scammed by Fake Brad Pitt for 800,000 Euros

Sierra Leone declares emergency after confirming second Mpox case in four days - CNBCTV18
summary:
Sierra Leone Declares Emergency After Second Mpox Case in Four Days

Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Sierra Leone has declared a state of emergency after confirming its second case of Mpox within four days, as health authorities express concern over the rapid spread of the disease.

  • The first case involved recent travel to the northern Port Loko District.
  • Both patients are currently receiving treatment in Freetown.
  • Mpox was first identified in 1958, historically affecting mostly people in central and West Africa.
  • In 2022, Mpox was confirmed to spread through sexual intercourse, leading to outbreaks in over 70 countries.
  • Sierra Leone was previously the epicentre of the 2014 Ebola outbreak, resulting in significant loss of life and healthcare workforce.
"The Congo has borne the brunt of the epidemic, with a vast majority of the roughly 43,000 suspected cases and 1,000 deaths in Africa this year."

This situation poses a significant public health challenge, especially in the context of Sierra Leone's past experiences with epidemics.
newTitle: Sierra Leone Declares Emergency After Second Mpox Case in Four Days

title: Sores in genital areas? This could be a sign of Herpes virus - The Times of India
summary:
Sores in genital areas? This could be a sign of Herpes virus

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

This article discusses the indications and implications of herpes simplex virus (HSV), highlighting symptoms, causes, and prevention strategies.

  • Herpes simplex virus causes sores in oral and genital areas.
  • Genital herpes is an STI; 1 in 5 women aged 14-49 are affected.
  • 67% of the global population under age 50 is at risk of HSV.
  • Risk factors include unprotected sex and multiple partners.
  • Early detection through various testing methods improves treatment outcomes.
  • Prevention includes abstinence, condom use, and maintaining hygiene during outbreaks.
“The common risk factors include sexual contact with someone infected with hsv-1 or hsv-2...” - Dr. Archana Dhawan Bajaj

Understanding and preventing herpes involves knowledge about its symptoms, responsible sexual practices, and timely medical intervention.
newTitle: Understanding Herpes: Symptoms, Causes, and Prevention Tips

title: Parliamentary panel to summon Meta over Mark Zuckerberg's remark on India polls: BJP MP - Hindustan Times
‘Would rather like people to be…’: ITC chairman Sanjiv Puri on 90-hour work week debate - Hindustan Times
summary:
ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Responds to 90-Hour Work Week Debate

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sanjiv Puri, chairman and MD of ITC Limited, expressed that the company prefers not to quantify work hours, focusing instead on employee engagement.

  • During a recent event, Sanjiv Puri highlighted that ITC emphasizes being part of the company's journey rather than logging hours.
  • Puri declined to specify work hour numbers, stressing a flexible work environment including remote work options.
  • This discussion comes in light of comments from L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for a 90-hour work week, which drew significant criticism.
“We would rather like people to be part of the company's journey and feel passionately involved.” - Sanjiv Puri

The remarks from both Sanjiv Puri and SN Subrahmanyan have sparked discussions on work-life balance in corporate settings, highlighting contrasting management philosophies.
newTitle: ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Responds to 90-Hour Work Week Debate

title: Meta To Get Parliamentary Panel Summons Over Zuckerberg's India Poll Remark - NDTV
summary:
"Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta

Date: January 10, 2024

Source: New Delhi

Social media giant Meta is set to be summoned by a Parliamentary Standing Committee due to remarks made by its CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, regarding the 2024 Indian general election.

  • Meta is being accused of spreading misinformation about the electoral results in India.
  • Zuckerberg's comments suggested a global trend where incumbent governments lost elections due to the COVID pandemic, incorrectly citing India as an example.
  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's claims, stating that the NDA led by PM Modi retained trust among voters in the recent elections.
  • The BJP faced some setbacks in elections but maintained a majority with support from allies.
"Misinformation on a democratic country maligns its image. The organization would have to apologize to the Parliament and the people here for this mistake." - Nishikant Dubey

The ruling BJP's response highlights the importance of factual accuracy in public statements, especially from influential leaders like Zuckerberg.
newTitle: "Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta
